alert.note: Alert for La Salle; Lee; Ogle (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued November 05 at 10:24AM CDT until November 05 at 10:45AM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 AM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN LA SALLE...EASTERN OGLE AND EASTERN LEE COUNTIES... At 1023 AM CDT, severe squalls with little to no lightning were located along a line extending from Ridott to near Stillman Valley to 6 miles west of Paw Paw to near Grand Ridge, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... La Salle, Rochelle, Mendota, Byron, Oregon, Oglesby, Davis Junction, Earlville, North Utica, Hillcrest, Stillman Valley, Ashton, Paw Paw, Naplate, Creston, Lindenwood, Monroe Center, Lee, Compton and Steward. This includes... Buffalo Rock State Park, Lowden State Park, Matthiessen State Park, Starved Rock State Park, and Tri-County Fairgrounds. Including the following interstates... I-39 between mile markers 57 and 114. I-80 between mile markers 78 and 87. I-88 between mile markers 66 and 82. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
